title: Material Planner
description:
**Material Planner**
====================

#### **Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.**

  

You will be working as a Material Planner and will be part of Process Automation Business Area for Measurement & Analytics division based in Bangalore, India. In this role you will be reporting to Manufacturing Unit Manager and will be responsible for end-to-end planning of inventory inclusive of sales in excess of invoicing from purchase requisition to customer invoice. Supporting internal customer service enquiries, setting inventory parameters, inventory targets and ensuring adequate replenishment of inventory through purchase orders.

### **Your responsibilities**

* Segmenting the portfolio of materials through an ABC / XYZ analysis, product lifecycle management and commercial policy. Defining the inventory policies according to this segmentation
* Calculating and maintaining the planning systems and ERPs the inventory parameter like safety stock, reorder point, lot size, lead-time and replenishment strategies
* Collaborating with buyers for obtaining the best possible supplier performance in terms of supplier on-time delivery, MOO, quality, lead-time and flexibility
* Working with operations buyers and GBS to align planning of material with call offs and ensuring that purchase requisitions are converted into purchase orders
* Managing MRP (Materials Resource Planning) exception messages on a daily basis, supporting cycle counting and year-end inventory counting
* Conducting financial risk assessments decisions relating to inventory, conducting root case analysis when necessary and analyzing excess and obsolete or aging inventory
* Taking appropriate action for optimizing inventory performance in collaboration with Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing and Procurement & Logistics

### **Your background**

* Bachelor of Engineering or Technology in any field
* Minimum 3 to 5 years of experience in Material Planning, Cross function team collaboration, forecasting, inventory management
* Must have experience in PPC and SAP MM and should be proficient in excel
* Should have exposure to Instrumentation, Automotive and Automobile industry

### **More about us**


ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning Work model: on site #LI-onsite

title: Business
description:
As NPI IT Business Partner you will be part of IT Eng organization, reporting directly to Head of IT Engineering & Dev Excellence and matrix to VP (Integrated Program Management). This role is responsible for partnering with different stakeholders from business and IT organization. You shall challenge the status quo and help Garrett define next generation of systems for NPI (New Product Introduction) landscape, based on company strategy/capabilities needed and evolving technologies/trends. The role includes owning the Program Management organization tools (umbrella systems for NPI), and orchestrating the related NPI IT landscape under, working closely with Enterprise Architecture. Strong collaboration is require with broader IT organization in terms of security, infrastruture, SW development, EA and Data excellence teams, together with wider business stakeholders with aim to balance cost optimization, rationalize complexity and build the future.


Responsibilities :


**Stakeholder Management**

* Collaborate with business leaders and stakeholders to deliver cost-effective and efficient systems solutions, targetting NPI for addressing business challenges, in alignment with Garrett IT strategy
* Proactively manage stakeholder expectations and establish partnership, effectively communicating progress, decision-making processes, and prioritization.
* owning the systems landscape together with enterprise architecture
* help define and execute change of future systems for PM organization and NPI 2,0 system orchestration
* Strong alignment with business (cross functional domains) to break silos and help identify transformation of cross functional processes , with automation, AI and other progressive trends
* Play a key role from IT standpoint and be a stakeholder of the Moby project (complex product including HW/SW/EE)
* Challenge the ways of thinking to bring in step change for Garrett future NPI landscape
* Manage ambiguity and take/enable decisions without having all datapoints

**Strategic mindset and drive**

* Establish and maintain strong cross-functional relationships with key stakeholders and IT, helping to define the next genration (NPI 2,0) system roadmap and value drive prioritized execution
* Drive organizational change and transformation initiatives by leveraging industry best practices, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to enhance the capabilities of the IT team and support the strategic growth of Garrett
* Drive High Performance culture within IT and with business stakeholders
* Complete ownership for PM tools (from ideation, development, roll out and maintenance)
* Actively coordinate all phases of project from concept, project planning, development, execution, monitoring to project closure
* Being courageous and getting things done with internal/external teams
* Ensure all pre-requisites for system transformation in NPI landscape are accounted for (data, integration, architectural principles & flexibility), together with ease of system usage

**Change management**

* Influence leadership and lead by example, together with external consultants, by orchestrating different dimensions of the NPI landscape (data, integration, architectural principle & flexibility, UX, progressive trends)
* Drive change management with business stakeholders for the next generation system/process landscape
* Manage system transformation initiatives based on company value and functional views
* active management and mitigation of technology related risks(e.g. Data Loss Prevention, Business continuity), track security and compliance-related KPIs and metrics, and assist with reporting on those metrics to stakeholders
* Enable adoption of new ways of working based on transformed process and system landscape
* Collaborate with extended IT teams (DevExcellence, Data Excellencey, Enterprise Architecture) to ensure standarized appropach is followed while excution of system changes

**Qualification :**

Bachelor's OR Masters Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Engineering.


**Experience :**

At least 10-12 years of experience in the field of Software Development, Business Partnering
  

Significant experience with large enginering enterprise systems, especially in definition and implementation (minimum 9 years.)
  

Experienced with cloud-based systems and architecture in terms of integrating on cloud, knowledge on latest trends and prpgressive technologies(AI/ML, Composoable architectures)
  

Strong business partnership and collaboration skills, in terms of understanding the need and challenging stakeholders to select best in class systems, including influencing business stakeholders in alignment with Garrett IT strategy


**Key Skill :**

* Strong Strategic thinker and planner
* Knowledge of budget management & financial planning
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and oral) with ability to communicate at all organizational levels;
* Solid business analysis, customer interaction and complex problem-solving skills
* Being proactive and can drive change management
* Proven self-starter; able to take initiative to build organization capability and to deliver committed results;
* Analysing business requirements and translating/them into correct technical solution and driving delivery
* Well integrated with IT teams and can work cross functionally to gather required support, influence and lead by example, enabling excellence for Garrett

  
This is an exciting time to join Garrett Motion! Garrett is one of the automotive industry’s most iconic brands, a global innovator and technology leader that enables vehicles to be cleaner, more efficient and connected. With a nearly 70-year legacy, we serve customers worldwide with passenger vehicle, commercial vehicle, aftermarket replacement, and performance enhancement solutions.
Our comprehensive portfolio of emission-reducing and zero-emission solutions advance sustainable motion, from world-class turbocharging and electric boosting technologies for hybrids, to electrified powertrains and automotive software.
With innovations that combine the best of mechanical and electric, Garrett is redefining zero-emission automotive technologies.

title: Hotel Manager
description:
We are seeking a professional and customer-focused hotel manager to oversee our hotel operations. In this position, you will direct the day-to-day operations and activities at your allocated hotel location. To excel in this role, you must be approachable and detailed-oriented with proven hospitality or management work experience. Our ideal candidate will also demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

title: Manager
description:
Job Title: Hotel Manager

Location: [NEDUMBASSERY]

Company: [Insert Hotel Name]

Overview:  
As the Manager of our prestigious four-star hotel, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of hotel operations, ensuring the highest standards of guest satisfaction, profitability, and employee engagement. You will lead a dedicated team, manage day-to-day activities, and work closely with department heads to maintain the hotel's reputation for excellence in hospitality.

Key Responsibilities:

* **Guest Experience Management**: Ensure exceptional guest experiences by maintaining high standards of service, cleanliness, and comfort throughout the hotel.
* **Team Leadership**: Lead and motivate a diverse team of staff, including front desk personnel, housekeeping, food and beverage, maintenance, and administrative staff.
* **Operations Oversight**: Oversee all operational aspects of the hotel, including front desk, reservations, housekeeping, food and beverage, maintenance, and security.
* **Financial Management**: Monitor financial performance, budgets, and expenses to ensure profitability and cost-effectiveness.
* **Sales and Marketing**: Collaborate with the sales and marketing team to develop strategies to attract guests, increase occupancy rates, and maximize revenue.
* **Quality Assurance**: Implement and maintain quality assurance standards to meet or exceed industry benchmarks and guest expectations.
* **Training and Development**: Provide training, coaching, and development opportunities for staff to enhance their skills and improve performance.
* **Safety and Compliance**: Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and legal regulations, as well as company policies and procedures.
* **Guest Relations**: Handle guest complaints and inquiries promptly and professionally, striving to resolve issues to the satisfaction of all parties involved.
* **Community Engagement**: Represent the hotel in the local community and foster positive relationships with stakeholders, including guests, suppliers, and local authorities.
* **Event Management**: Oversee the planning and execution of events, conferences, and functions hosted at the hotel.
* **Continuous Improvement**: Identify areas for improvement and implement initiatives to enhance guest satisfaction, operational efficiency, and employee morale.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field preferred.
* Previous experience in hotel management or related roles, preferably in a four-star or higher-rated hotel.
* Proven leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to achieve common goals.
* Strong financial acumen and experience in budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in hotel management software and Microsoft Office suite.
* Knowledge of industry trends, best practices, and regulations.
* Customer-focused mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional service.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays, as required by the demands of the hospitality industry.

title: Demand Planner
description:
**Location:**Mumbai, IN, IN
**Job Function:** Supply Chain Management
**Requisition Number:** 142254
**Description:****Job Summary**

Demand planners primarily focus on analyzing historical data, market trends, and customer behavior to forecast future demand for products or services. Demand Planners work closely with sales, marketing, and other relevant departments to gather necessary inputs and develop accurate demand forecasts. Their role involves understanding customer preferences, seasonality, promotions, and other factors that impact demand. Demand planners ensure that sufficient inventory is available to meet customer demand and minimize stockouts while optimizing inventory levels and costs.
**General Responsibilities**
* Forecasting: Develop and maintain accurate demand forecasts using historical data, market trends, and collaboration with relevant departments.
* Collaboration: Work closely with sales, marketing, and product teams to gather insights and align demand plans with business goals.
* S&OP Facilitation: Lead and facilitate S&OP meetings, bringing together cross-functional teams to review and align on the sales and operations plan.
* Inventory Management: Ensure that inventory levels are optimized based on demand forecasts and production plans.
* Data Analysis: Analyse demand patterns, supply chain performance, and other relevant data to improve forecasting and planning accuracy.
* Scenario Planning: Conduct scenario analyses to evaluate the impact of different business decisions on the supply chain and financial performance.
* Communication: Effectively communicate the S&OP plan and related information across the organization.
* Continuous Improvement: Implement and refine demand planning and S&OP processes to enhance overall efficiency.
**Functional Skills and Knowledge**
* Higher education, preferably in Engineering.
* 2-5 years of experience in planning in an industrial environment.
* Experience in logistics management areas.
* Demonstrable experience in the management of industrial technical purchases.
* Demonstrate advanced SAP skills is a must, CRM systems an advantage
* Demonstrate fluency in English, both written and spoken and fluency in two or more language
* Analyze data to identify patterns and insights for accurate demand forecasting.
* Utilize statistical analysis and forecasting techniques to develop precise demand forecasts.
* Understand supply chain dynamics to align demand plans with supply capabilities.
* Stay updated with market trends and competitor analysis to incorporate external factors into forecasting.
**Education**

MBA or Master’s degree in business administration, industrial engineering, strategic management or a related field
A minimum of 2-3 years working experience in a comparable role in a corporate or consulting environment.

title: Head of Project Management
description:
At Mace, our purpose is to redefine the boundaries of ambition. We believe in creating places that are responsible, bringing transformative impact to our people, communities and societies across the globe. To learn more about or purpose, culture, and priorities, visit our strategy site.



Within our consult business we harness our unique combination of leading-edge practical expertise and project delivery consultancy to unlock the potential in every project.


The project:


This is a commercial project in Pune.



Our values shape the way we consult, and define the people we want to join us on our journey, they are:



Safety first - Going home safe and well:


* You will be a leading advocate of Mace's value of safety first, and be accountable for leading and maintaining exceptional safety, quality, cost, programme, sustainability and project compliance standards.
* You will possess advanced technical expertise in local health and safety rules and regulations relevant to project portfolio.
* You will champion a diverse and inclusive working environment and understand the importance of the wellbeing of the people you manage.


Client focus – Deliver on our promise:


* You will ensure the successful delivery of key assignments and defined business areas, providing strategic direction and monitoring delivery aligned with overall vision and objectives.
* You will be responsible for delivery from project inception/brief, through design development and planning, contractor procurement and construction phase in accordance with the overall delivery program and agreed project milestones.
* On behalf of external/third-party clients, you will oversee the project management of the project on an individual and team basis from inception to post-completion.


Integrity – Always do the right thing:


* You will be responsible for project budgets and ensure operations are fiscally and ethically viable and meet organisational and legislative compliance obligations.
* You will support the Operations Director and other senior stakeholders to directly influence long term development of strategy for a function or Business Unit (BU), creating a sustainable business future.
* You will commit to making a positive impact for our people, our clients, and our planet, and take ownership for holding others to account who do not uphold the Mace values.


Create opportunity for our people to excel:


* You will lead your team effectively and develop others to reach their full potential.
* You will actively network, innovate, and seek understanding of best practice, utilising the full depth of knowledge of Mace Group, the Centres of Excellence, Mace Way Control Centre and Knowledge Hub.
* You will collaborate with multiple internal and external stakeholders, up to C-Suite, to implement and manage our programmes.


You’ll need to have:


* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in civil.
* Experience in planning and scheduling of any project of similar nature.
* Lead a team of Design Manager/MEP Manager/Planners/Construction Manager and other project stakeholders.


You’ll also have:


* Membership of RICS, CIOB, APM, ICE or equivalent demonstrable professional or personal development.
* Extensive experience in the successful delivery phase of projects and programmes in the construction sector.
* Deep property or infrastructure project management expertise.
* Strong commercial and financial acumen.
* Leadership and management experience of large, diverse teams.
* Experience of managing relationships with key senior stakeholders.
* Knowledge of how carbon and sustainability considerations will shape the outlook of the projects you are working on.

Mace is an inclusive employer and welcomes interest from a diverse range of candidates. Even if you feel you do not fulfil all of the criteria, please apply as you may still be the best candidate for this role or another role within our organization.

title: HVAC Supervisor
description:
Job Description: Site Supervisor

Position Summary:  
The Site Supervisor plays a pivotal role in overseeing and coordinating on-site construction activities to ensure projects are completed safely, efficiently, and according to specifications. They are responsible for managing labor resources, enforcing safety regulations, and maintaining communication with project stakeholders to achieve project objectives within budget and timeline constraints.

Key Responsibilities:

* Site Management: Supervise and coordinate daily construction activities on-site, including scheduling, material procurement, and resource allocation to ensure timely project completion. Monitor progress against project plans and adjust schedules or resources as needed to meet deadlines.
* Safety Compliance: Enforce safety protocols and regulations to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel on-site. Conduct regular safety inspections, identify potential hazards, and take corrective actions to mitigate risks. Provide safety training and guidance to workers to promote adherence to safety standards.
* Quality Assurance: Ensure that construction work meets quality standards and specifications outlined in project plans and contracts. Conduct inspections of completed work, identify defects or deficiencies, and coordinate with subcontractors or tradespeople to address issues promptly.
* Team Leadership: Supervise and motivate construction teams, including laborers, subcontractors, and tradespeople, to achieve project goals and objectives. Provide guidance, support, and feedback to ensure high performance and productivity levels among team members.
* Communication and Coordination: Maintain regular communication with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and project managers, to provide updates on project progress, resolve issues, and address concerns. Coordinate with subcontractors and suppliers to ensure timely delivery of materials and equipment to the construction site.
* Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of daily construction activities, including work progress, labor hours, equipment usage, and material deliveries. Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly progress reports to project management to track project milestones and performance metrics.
* Problem Solving: Identify and resolve construction-related issues, conflicts, and challenges that arise during the course of the project. Collaborate with project stakeholders to develop effective solutions and implement corrective actions to minimize disruptions and delays.
* Cost Control: Monitor project expenditures and labor costs to ensure adherence to budgetary constraints and financial targets. Identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization, reduce waste, and improve efficiency to maximize project profitability.

Qualifications:

* High school diploma or equivalent; Bachelor's degree in construction management or a related field preferred.
* Proven experience as a site supervisor or foreman in the construction industry.
* Strong knowledge of construction methods, techniques, and safety regulations.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple priorities, and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in construction management software and Microsoft Office applications.
* Certification in construction safety (e.g., OSHA 30-Hour Construction Safety) is preferred.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.
* Willingness to work extended hours, weekends, and holidays as needed to meet project deadlines.

This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position and is not an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities, or working conditions associated with it. Responsibilities and activities may change or be adjusted based on the needs of the employer and industry trends.

* Day shift

title: Demand Manager
description:
Business: Piramal Critical Care
  

Department: Supply Chain
  

Location: Kurla, Mumbai
  

Travel: Medium


**Job Overview*** The Demand Planning Manager is responsible for supporting demand planning team in preparing the global monthly demand within PCC.
* This position is responsible for the development and maintenance of global demand forecasts that are used for supply planning and control purposes across the organization.
* Achieve consensus for operational demand forecasts by facilitating a collaborative planning process with sales, marketing and finance personnel.
* Candidate is also responsible for master data management in the system and supporting MIS during the leadership meetings. **l**

**Reporting Structure:**Reports to Associate Director Global Planning
**Experience:*** Minimum three years experience in Planning and Inventory Management, preferable from the pharma industry in global markets
* Strong experience with software tools such as Excel, ERP, and/or Access required. Proficiency in statistics, forecasting, and planning skills required, along with a good, basic
* business acumen.
* Demonstrated proficiency in statistics, forecasting and forecasting methods with an understanding of their financial and operational impacts.
* Knowledge of SAP/APO or other software related to demand planning is preferred.
* Expert level MS Excel/Access capability/data analysis
* Ability to work collaboratively across functions, including with Commercial Leadership to present analyses, challenge thinking, and influence outcomes
* Highly organized and able to work independently
* Accuracy, attention to detail, flexibility, and the ability to work in a fast-paced deadline driven environment

**Competencies:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Detailed oriented, ability to multitask, strong analytical competency, creative, and able to present various solutions
* Effective organizational skills with the ability to succeed in the self-directed work environment
* Energetic, enthusiastic and motivational disposition
* Ability to prioritize, organize and adhere to deadlines
* Maintain confidentiality

**Key Role and Responsibilities:****Demand Planning & Forecasting**

Develop, oversee and manage a robust forecasting process through GAINS Planning System as a primary forecasting system tool
Oversee the preparation of the baseline forecast by reviewing statistical models on timely basis
Develop demand forecasts (operational forecasts) at multiple levels of aggregation for multiple time horizons
Responsible for conducting monthly Consensus demand process with the Sales team
Achieve and prepare a consensus forecast by facilitating a collaborative planning process with sales, marketing and finance personnel. Collaboratively interact with sales,
marketing, supply chain and finance to understand demand forecast drivers. The Demand Planner is the integration point into the sales and commercial organization for all
forecasting.
Support Sales & Operational Planning meetings for each sales organization
**Revenue Management:**

* Generate quarterly revenue forecast (on weekly basis) and work with the regional supply chain directors and site planners to ensure achievement of revenue targets. Also
* responsible for Identifying potential country-wise and region-wise shortfalls.
* Review Order Book on weekly basis and closely work with site planners to keep it updated.
* Develop, maintain and align master data in Product Master & GAINS

**Demand Handover:**

* Lead monthly handover calls, providing demand requirements to the site planners and/or CMOs
* Support in generating the required forecasts for CMOs and key suppliers, including POs for the binding forecasts
* Closely coordinate and communicate customer action plans with supply planning
* Generate and publish the quarterly long-term demand capacity plan.

**Review & MIS**

* Prepare and maintain relevant reports and presentations pertaining to demand planning process
* Performs monthly forecast reviews with each of the global regional sales leaders.
* Runs regular reports to provide key business metrics and information to appropriate users
* Work with regulatory team to report stock outs

  
In the three decades of its existence, Piramal Group has pursued a twin strategy of both organic and inorganic growth.
Driven by its core values, Piramal Group steadfastly pursues inclusive growth, while adhering to ethical and values-driven practices.  

  

**Equal employment opportunity**Piramal Group is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetics, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.  

  

We base our employment decisions on merit considering qualifications, skills, performance, and achievements. We endeavor to ensure that all applicants and employees receive equal opportunity in personnel matters, including recruitment, selection, training, placement, promotion, demotion, compensation and benefits, transfers, terminations, and working conditions, including reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities as well as individuals with needs related to their religious observance or practice.
  
Piramal Critical Care (PCC), under Piramal Pharma Limited (PPL), a subsidiary of Piramal Enterprises Limited, is the third largest producer of Inhaled Anaesthetics and a global player in hospital generics. Motivated by its vision to deliver critical care solutions for patients and healthcare providers across the globe, PCC is committed to enabling sustainable and profitable growth for all its stakeholders.


PCC maintains a wide presence across the USA, Europe and more than 100 countries across the globe. Its rich product portfolio includes Inhalation Anaesthetics such as Sevoflurane, Isoflurane and Halothane as well as Intrathecal Baclofen therapy, for spasticity management. PCC has wholly-owned, state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in the US and India that have successfully cleared periodical inspections by the US FDA, UK MHRA and other regulators.


Its core strength lies in a highly qualified global workforce of more than 400 employees across 16 countries. PCC is focused on further expanding its global footprint through new product additions in the critical care space.


Committed to corporate social responsibility alongside Piramal Group, PCC collaborates with various partner organizations and proudly takes an active role in providing hope and resources to those in need, as well as caring for the environment.

title: Planner
description:
**About us:**


As a Fortune 50 company with more than 400,000 team members worldwide, Target is an iconic brand and one of America's leading retailers.


Working at Target means the opportunity to help all families discover the joy of everyday life. Caring for our communities is woven into who we are, and we invest in the places we collectively live, work and play. We prioritize relationships, fuel and develop talent by creating growth opportunities, and succeed as one Target team. At our core, our purpose is ingrained in who we are, what we value, and how we work. It’s how we care, grow, and win together.

  

Target Merchandising is evolving at an incredible pace. We are constantly reimagining how this $106 billion retailer offers the innovative, guest-inspiring items that Target is known and loved for. Our goal is to deliver exceptional value, quality and style to elevate Target as the premier retailer in a competitive global marketplace. Through intelligent and progressive business strategies that make the most of Target’s resources and partnerships worldwide, Merchandising works across product categories to create a localized shopping experience online and in our 1800 stores. Are you a creative problem solver who loves to see your work translate into real results? Can you collaborate effectively, execute a plan efficiently and positively influence how Target chooses and presents the right product in the right place at the right price? If so, you will have success on one of our dynamic teams.  

  

A role in Planning means being in charge of the financials and forecasting for one of Target’s businesses. Here, you’ll conduct comparative analysis of holiday or other seasonal performance reports and provide the insights that inform the Inventory team’s work to ensure that product supports projected sales. Acting as the hub between Merchandising and Supply Chain, you will create a financial link between these two essential groups and have a voice in some of the most important decisions from a financial strategy standpoint.  

  

As a Merchandise Planner, you’ll provide in-season decision support, collaborate on assortment planning, recommend localization and channel strategies including cluster types and profiles, and lead demand forecasting. You’ll support the divisional strategy through your category expertise and partnerships with cross-functional teams and vendors. You will head up the open-to-buy process and decide on category-level investment and the financial validity of assortments. You will conduct root cause analysis for variation between supply and demand forecasts to support “chase-cancel” decisions and communicate implications to vendors. You’ll conduct scenario planning, build unit plans, and lead initial set planning and operationalization to optimize assortments. A large part of your role will be to interpret forecast results and conduct “what if?” analysis to guide your go-forward recommendations. You will validate the unit promo planning forecast, drive maintenance, risk analysis and decision-making by the Pricing & Promotion Center of Excellence. And you’ll run event forecast creation and flow, analyzing item lifecycles and driving recommendations on end-of-season management.  

  

Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.  

  

**About you:**  

* Four-year degree or equivalent experience
* 2-6 years of relevant experience
* 1+ years of Merchandising experience
* Strong strategic, financial, and analytical skills; can easily translate data from an array of sources into insights and recommendations
* Strong collaboration skills to partner with cross-functional teams
* Flexible, resilient and comfortable working in “grey areas” that are constantly changing

title: Deputy Manager
description:
Position Title
**Dy. Manager**
---------------


Region
**Maharashtra**
---------------


City
**Pune**
--------


**Job Description**
-------------------


**Department :** Central Planning


**Job Title :** Asst. Manager /Dy. Manager


**Grade :** M1/M2 Location : Pune


1. **Purpose of the position**  

The prime responsibility for the position is to plan production activities centrally ( All Units ),  

systematically in consultation with the Plant , Sales & Marketing team and ensuring smooth  

availability of products as per market requirements by coordinating with the Supply Chain.  

He/She must be well-versed with PPIC (Production, Planning & Inventory Control ).


**2.Reporting Relationships**


Position reports to : **Manager**  

Sub-ordinates reporting to this position **Engineers**


**3.Qualification & Experience required**


Qualification: BE/B-Tech Mechanical, Production, Industrial  

Experience: 8– 10 Years of relevant experience in Manufacturing Industry


**4.Customers Served**


Internal: Manufacturing, PPC, Quality Control , R&D , Sales .  

External: End Customers


**5.Size of the Role**


Financial: Function Level  

Non-Financial: Unit Level


**6. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Required**


**Job Responsibilities:**  

1. Job or Task Scheduling -


Preparation of time and action calendar for each order from order receiving to  

shipment. The job schedule contains list of tasks to be processed for the styles.  

Against each task’s planner mentions when to start a task and what is dead line for  

that task. Name of responsible person (department) for the job is being listed. For  

example, scheduling planned cut date (PCD), line loading date etc  

2. Mfg.& Sales Plan Preparation -


Preparation of Sales and Manufactring plan with Co-ordination with Sales  

Team and Plants  

3. FIFO Loading Production & Track of Material Availability Planning -


Processes needed to complete an order FIFO vary style to style. According to  

the order (customer) requirement PPC department select processes for the orders.  

Sometime extra processes are eliminated to reduce cost of production. Tracking of  

Material situation and status against requirements  

4. Process Selection & Planning


Where a company has multiple factories (facilities) for production and factories  

are set for specific product, planner need to identify which facility will be most suitable  

for new orders. Sometimes there may be a capacity shortage in a factory, in that case  

planner need to decide which facility will selected for that orders.  

5. Facility Location


PPC department plays a major role during order booking. They decide  

(suggest) how much order they should accept according to their production capacity.  

Allocating of total capacity or deciding how much capacity to be used for an order out  

of total factory capacity. Regularly updating factories current capacity (production  

capacity).  

6. Capacity Planning


Preparing detailed line planning with daily production target for the production  

line. Most cases line planning is made after discussing with production team and  

Industrial engineers. Communication of Capacity status to Sales Team periodically .  

7. Line Planning


Whatever plan is made is executed by PPC department. PPC department  

keeps close look whether everything is progressing according the plan. Chasing other  

department heads on daily basis to keep plan on track. They update order wise  

completed tasks on the Time & action Calendar. When they found something is  

going to be late they expedite and create an alarm about the delay.  

8. Follow up and Execution  

Planner estimate daily production (units) according to the styles work content.


**7. Functional Competencies Required**


Sr. No. Competency Description Level of Competency Required (1 – Basic to 5 – Expert)
  

1 SAP system knowledge 4 – Proficient
  

2 2 Excel and PPT knowledge 4 – Proficient
  

3 3 Good Analytical Knowledge 4 – Proficient
  

4 4 Manufacturing process awareness 4 – Proficient
  

**8. Behavioral Competencies Required**


S. No. Competency Description Level of Competency Required (1 – Basic to 5 – Expert)
  

1 Interpersonal Skills 4 – Proficient
  

2 Performance leadership 5 – Expert
  

3 Collaboration 5 – Expert

title: Visual Designer
description:
**Description**
---------------


**About the role:**

Experienced member of the Creative Journey & Branding Team with responsibility for digital branding experience across a portfolio of internal and external global conferences. Plan and execute the creative and operational aspects of conferences with a focus on development and creation of digital and creative/graphic elements that enhance the attendee journey. Conference planner with responsibility for the development, management and execution of various conference elements relating the attendee journey.


**What You'll Do:**

* Lead the creative journey for Gartner’s external conferences and internal (corporate) events with a focus on impactful attendee (delegate, sponsors, and associates) journeys across the global portfolio focusing on Digital Experience and in conjunction with build and branding elements
* Creation of basic 2D design elements and motion graphics
* Management of operational process, and project management through planning process and execution at internal and external client events both in-person and virtual.
* Project manage the planning and implementation of all Digital Experience elements including; event technology, digital signage and other digital elements
* Collaborate with the Creative Journey & Branding team on signage, build, branding, furniture and finishing/accessory requirements for selected events in collaboration with the wider conferences team.
* Assist with the creation and implementation of operational process and project management playbooks to maximize the impact of the role and team across all regions and portfolios.
* Creative, innovative, and proactive approach to all aspects of the role – constantly seeking to exceed previous experiences and increase the effectiveness of all processes.
* Collaboration with Gartner Business Units to strategically advise and support their event objectives throughout the planning process - culminating with the conference experience.
* Build excellent relationships with the vendor partners – leading them to a Gartner level of creativity, innovation and passion towards conferences.
* Effective financial management and predictability including budget creation, cost negotiation and accurate forecasting; highlight risks, recommendations for allocation of funds and management of a production planning calendar.
* Flawless execution of the digital experience within the attendee journey across global conferences and events
* Conference consistency through standardized and operational processes, project management and best practices both during pre-conference planning and onsite execution

**What You'll Need:**

* 2+ Years Event Management, Branding and/or Experiential & Event Marketing Experience
* Bachelor's degree
* Proven creative and operational management responsibility in a team setting
* Proven event operational and project management skills
* Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize workload
* Management of multiple agency and vendor partners
* Strong skills in Adobe Illustrator or similar with experience in 2D graphic and motion graphic design preferred
* Experience in creation of event spaces/environments/floor plans
* Proven and exceptional project management skills, effective management of time and prioritization
* Creative, innovative, strategic
* Strong financial management skills
* Client focused, solution oriented and collaborative
* High sense of urgency, decisiveness, attention to detail and confidentiality
* Fully competent in Microsoft office and Google Suite, especially PowerPoint, Excel and similar in G-Suite
* Strong oral & written communication skills
* Willingness to travel approximately 30% of time

#LI-MW3

**Who are we?**

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), we deliver actionable, objective insight that drives smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s mission-critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.


**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**

Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner


**What we offer:**

Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
**CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER**

We are looking for a high caliber, professional CFO who shall impart direction and take responsibility to move the company to new / further heights in the ever-evolving Economic Scenario.

**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* Ensure full transparency over the financial performance of the company and overall responsibility for total management of Finance, Accounts, MIS, Taxation Team.
* Effectively and clearly communicate potential risks in a timely manner.
* Maintain speed and accuracy of billings and client payments.
* Coordinate and produce all tax documentation as required.
* The CFO should be able to manage & plan all the financial requirements of the company and should be able to cover aspects related to Banking & Finance. Tracking cash flow & financial planning. Analyzing the company's financial strength & weakness & proposing strategic directions.
* Keeping cash flow stable, develop accurate financial scenarios. Developing the company's budget, communicating with company’s banks regularly, overseeing financial planning & analyzing.
* Must possess a level of technical acumen & experience in finance & building predictive models.
* Responsible for contributing to the attainment of the company’s goals, objectives, business growth and expansion by providing strategic financial models and develop necessary financial policies and procedures to ensure sound Financial Management and Controls of the business.
* Financial planning and analysis, cash flow management, Fund Raising, short term and long-term borrowings, fund management, investments, project financing and dis-investments and development of strategic business models, identifying risks and deficiencies.
* Forecast short term and long-term financial needs of the company based on business plan and projects on hand, identify sources and mobilize funds at a low cost.
* The CFO should prepare the company towards IPO.
* Develop/Increase financial rating for the company so as to avail loans from reputed banks at competitive rate of interest.
* Design SOPs and implement them across the board.

**Qualification & Skills:**

* Bachelor's degree in accounting, Finance or related field (MBA preferred).
* Professional accounting designation (CA, CMA or CPA).
* 20+ years of proven experience in a senior financial managerial position.
* Must have handled Transaction portfolio of 100 billion.
* Advanced computer skills, including proficiency in MS Office & Microsoft Dynamics SL financial reporting software.
* Exceptional communication skills.
* Results-oriented, strategic thinker and planner.
* In-depth knowledge of corporate financial law and risk management practices.

title: Transport Planner
description:
***With a startup spirit and 115,000 + curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it! We dream in digital,*** ***dare in reality, and reinvent the ways companies work to make an impact far bigger than just our bottom line.*** ***We’re harnessing the power of technology and humanity to create meaningful transformation that moves us forward in our pursuit of a world that works better for people.******Now,*** ***we’re calling upon the thinkers and doers, those with a natural curiosity and a hunger to keep learning, keep growing. People who thrive on fearlessly experimenting, seizing opportunities, and pushing boundaries to turn our vision into reality. And as you help us create a better world, we will help you build your own intellectual firepower.******Welcome to the relentless pursuit of better.******Inviting applications for the role of*** ***Business Analyst - Transportation Planner******The Transportation Planner occupies a pivotal role in the execution of transportation plans and strategies. You are*** ***directly responsible for the transportation order, shipment delivery to the customer, load optimization, shipment tendering, routing guide compliance, and shipment plan/carrier service execution, and track & trace functions. You must work effectively across all CS&L functions, and cooperatively with numerous service providers, to ensure timely pick-up/delivery of Finished Goods shipments within the client’s varied ANZ network. The ideal candidate is ready to get into the weeds and work hard to drive results while honing their skillset and developing efficiencies in the daily task load. This is very much an operations role that allows the ideal candidate to*** ***showcase communications skills, time management, relationship development, and problem resolution to make their desk their own.******Responsibilities***
======================

***Financial Management**** ***Support Administration Officer with invoice processing and dispute resolution follow up.***

* ***Review invoices to ensure correct charges are applied.***

* ***Vendors follow up on invoice dispute and resolution.***

***Transaction Processing**** ***Ensure all local authorities, ports and freight forwarders have the relevant documentation for customs clearance.***

* ***Contact and follow up on the exporter for all supporting documentation (i.e., bill of landing, quarantine declaration, health cert, commercial invoice, pack list, temperature declaration).***

* ***Ensure all checks and holds are cleared (i.e., MPI clearance checks, credit holds, tracking 01/172 MPI inspection on applicable products, etc.).***

* ***Organize transships or local transport from the port of entry to its local destination. Follow up to ensure avoidance of detention and demurrage charges.***

* ***Coordinate all sea freight shipments (imports/exports), ensuring that all required bookings are in place with the relevant third parties involved.***

* ***Organized air freight shipments were required on an ad-hoc basis.***

* ***Organize sea freight quotes where necessary for either spot requests or new lanes requests.***

***Reporting**** ***Track shipments from origin through to port of entry while monitoring ETAs were required.***

***Communication**** ***Carrier management: manage relationship, metrics, and operational matters with all key vendors (sea freight carriers, air freight carriers, freight forwarders, shipping lines, customs brokers, and warehouse – both internal and 3PL).***

* ***Liaise with AU/NZ Export Documentation team to ensure all shipping documentation is processed and released in full and on time.***

* ***Collaborate with S&OP (Planners), Manufacturing (Schedulers) and Procurement to ensure orders are placed and processed correctly as well as making sure all shipping documentation is received on time.***

* ***Communicate with both internal and external transport and warehouse teams to inform of incoming freight and ensure unloading/devanning time.***

* ***Hold relationships with external authorities such as government agencies and support external audits.***

* ***Prioritize the work, proactively manage stake holders.***

* ***Able to provide recommendation on Invoice dispute due to incorrect charge, changes to network layout whenever necessary.***

***Qualifications we seek in you!***
====================================

***Minimum Qualifications**** ***Associate degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Manufacturing, Business, or related field***

* ***Experience in Transportation (carrier experience preferred), Logistics, Demand/Supply Planning, Deployment/Replenishment Planning, or similar supply chain-related functions.***

* ***Strong Communication in English– both oral and written skills. Ability to communicate efficiency with all levels of management and peers, both internally and externally***

* ***Self-motivated and independent personality with strong negotiation & problem-solving skills.***

***Preferred Qualifications/ Skills**** ***Previous TMS, WMS experience, Basic ERP system experience.***

* ***Proficiency in MS Office Suite (esp. Excel / PowerPoint)***

* ***International Shipping knowledge required.***

* ***Ability to work principally with minimum supervision, problem solve independently.***

* ***Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal skills.***

* ***Worked in a high-volume transaction environment.***

* ***Ability to work well in a team environment.***

* ***Able to meet deadlines consistently.***

* ***Sound knowledge of financial and operational decisions around freight management.***

***Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.*** ***Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For more information, visit*** ***www.genpact.com.****Follow us on* ***Twitter****,* ***Facebook****,* ***LinkedIn****, and* ***YouTube****.****Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such*** ***scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.*** ***Job****Business Analyst*

***Primary Location****India-Bangalore*

***Schedule****Full-time*

***Education Level****Bachelor's / Graduation / Equivalent*

***Job Posting****Feb 8, 2024, 2:53:49 AM*

***Unposting Date****Ongoing*

title: Project Accountant
description:
Company Description
  
  

Work with Us. Change the World.
  
  

At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.
  
  

There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.
  
  

We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.
  
  

Job Description
  
  

* Supports moderately complex project(s), working under general supervision.
* Prepares various financial reports and provides analysis and recommendations based on findings.
* Requires a proven ability to apply professional concepts in a productive, consistent manner. Maintains records according to generally accepted accounting practices.
* Performs audits and generates special financial reports.
* Reviews projects for accurate revenue recognition and provides project analysis and recommendations based on findings.


Qualifications
  
  

Additional Information
  
  

About AECOM
  
  

AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $14.4 billion in fiscal year 2023. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.
  
  

Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity
  
  

You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
  
  

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
  
  

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
  
  

Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
  
  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
  
  

**ReqID:** J10102620
  
  

**Business Line:** Geography OH
  
  

**Business Group:** DCS
  
  

**Strategic Business Unit:** GBS
  
  

**Career Area:** Finance
  
  

**Work Location Model:** Please Select

title: Gn - Strategy - Mc - Insurance- Retirements - 11
description:
**Analyst/ Consultant – Insurance**

Find endless opportunities to solve our clients' toughest challenges, as you work with exceptional people, the latest tech and leading companies across industries.

**Practice:** Industry Consulting, Capability Network **I** **Areas of Work:** Insurance (core)| **Level:** Analyst / Consultant | **Location:** Delhi, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Bangalore | **Years of Exp:** 2-7 years

**Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture**


Are you an outcome-oriented problem solver? Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest?


Then, Accenture Strategy and Consulting is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities.


As a part of the Insurance practice, you will leverage our industry experience, domain expertise and transformative technologies, to help insurers, reinsurers and insurance brokers thrive in a dynamic future..


Together, let’s redefine their operating models and power up their growth journey. Help us unlock new value in a disruptive world, with the following initiatives:

* **Deliver assigned Insurance projects** spanning areas such as claims transformation, distribution and marketing transformation, cost reduction, digital transformation, tech/ ops transformation, applied intelligence, analytics, automation and so on. expertise in Insurance value chain
* **Support the leadership in business development and drafting appropriate responses** to win new business for Accenture
* **Manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders** and help the team liaison with other groups for successful project delivery
* **Build and leverage network within Accenture** to bring the best of Accenture capabilities to the client
* **Help grow the practice** and attract the best talent
* **Support asset development**, contribute to thought leadership, staffing needs, and capacity building

**Bring your best skills forward to excel in the role:**


An experienced consultant with the focus on transformation across retirement products including individual retirements (fixed annuity and variable annuity) and retirement services (401 (K), mutual funds, 403(b), etc.). The successful candidate will play a key role in guiding clients through the process of modernizing and optimizing their retirement process functions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies, and implementing best practices to achieve strategic objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead and support the digital transformation and modernization of retirement plan platforms and servicing channels by leveraging technology solutions to enhance efficiency and user experience.
* Stay abreast of emerging technology use cases in retirements & life insurance and recommend innovative solutions for clients.
* Close key product gaps and build seamless market leading user experiences.
* Reduce direct cost of client servicing through improved usability, self-servicing, automation, and straight through processes to eliminate manual work.
* Collaborate with clients to develop and implement strategic plans for transforming their retirement functions.
* Evaluate and redesign retirement processes to improve efficiency and productivity.
* Identify automation opportunities and implement streamlined workflows for retirement plan administration and benefits management.

  

**Qualifications:**

* Professional certifications such as FSRI, Certified Employee Benefit Specialist (CEBS) or Certified Financial Planner (CFP) are highly desirable.
* Proven experience in leading retirement plan transformations, including technology adoption and process optimization.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to diverse audiences.
* Familiarity with relevant software and tools, including retirement plan administration systems, benefits management systems, and digital transformation platforms.
* Strong consulting and technology acumen
* Expertise in insurance value chain spanning distribution, underwriting, policy, customer service
